metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: JavaScript Tutorial
Learn JavaScript
JavaScript is the world's most popular programming language.
content.html: JavaScript is the world's most popular programming language.

content.text: JavaScript is the programming language of the Web.
content.html: JavaScript is the programming language of the Web.

content.text: JavaScript is easy to learn.
content.html: JavaScript is easy to learn.

content.text: This tutorial will teach you JavaScript from basic to advanced.
content.html: This tutorial will teach you JavaScript from basic to advanced.

content.text: Examples in Each Chapter
With our "Try it Yourself" editor, you can edit the source code and view the result.
content.html: With our "Try it Yourself" editor, you can edit the source code and view the result.

content.code_html: My First JavaScript

content.text: Use the Menu
We recommend reading this tutorial, in the sequence listed in the menu.
content.html: We recommend reading this tutorial, in the sequence listed in the menu.

content.text: If you have a large screen, the menu will always be present on the left.
content.html: If you have a large screen, the menu will always be present on the left.

content.text: If you have a small screen, open the menu by clicking the top menu sign ☰ .
content.html: If you have a small screen, open the menu by clicking the top menu sign ☰.

content.text: Learn by Examples
Examples are better than 1000 words. Examples are often easier to understand than text explanations.
content.html: Examples are better than 1000 words. Examples are often easier to understand than text explanations.

content.text: This tutorial supplements all explanations with clarifying "Try it Yourself" examples.
content.html: This tutorial supplements all explanations with clarifying "Try it Yourself" examples.

content.text: If you try all the examples, you will learn a lot about JavaScript, in a very short time!
content.html: If you try all the examples, you will learn a lot about JavaScript, in a very short time!

content.text: Why Study JavaScript?
JavaScript is one of the 3 languages all web developers must learn:
content.html: JavaScript is one of the 3 languages all web developers must learn:

content.text: 1. HTML to define the content of web pages
content.html: 1. HTML to define the content of web pages

content.text: 2. CSS to specify the layout of web pages
content.html: 2. CSS to specify the layout of web pages

content.text: 3. JavaScript to program the behavior of web pages
content.html: 3. JavaScript to program the behavior of web pages

content.text: This tutorial covers every version of JavaScript:
content.html: This tutorial covers every version of JavaScript:

content.text: Learning Speed
In this tutorial, the learning speed is your choice.
content.html: In this tutorial, the learning speed is your choice.

content.text: Everything is up to you.
content.html: Everything is up to you.

content.text: If you are struggling, take a break, or re-read the material.
content.html: If you are struggling, take a break, or re-read the material.

content.text: Always make sure you understand all the "Try-it-Yourself" examples.
content.html: Always make sure you understand all the "Try-it-Yourself" examples.

content.text: The only way to become a clever programmer is to: Practice. Practice. Practice. Code. Code. Code !
content.html: The only way to become a clever programmer is to: Practice. Practice. Practice. Code. Code. Code !

content.text: Commonly Asked Questions
You don't have to get or download JavaScript.
content.html: You don't have to get or download JavaScript.

content.text: JavaScript is already running in your browser on your computer, on your tablet, and on your smart-phone.
content.html: JavaScript is already running in your browser on your computer, on your tablet, and on your smart-phone.

content.text: JavaScript is free to use for everyone.
content.html: JavaScript is free to use for everyone.

content.text: JavaScript Exercises
Many chapters in this tutorial end with an exercise where you can check your level of knowledge.
content.html: Many chapters in this tutorial end with an exercise where you can check your level of knowledge.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
What is a correct syntax for assigning a value to a variable?
content.html: What is a correct syntax for assigning a value to a variable?

metadata.question: What is a correct syntax for assigning a value to a variable?

content.question: What is a correct syntax for assigning a value to a variable?

content.text: See all JavaScript Exercises
content.html: See all JavaScript Exercises

content.text: JavaScript Quiz Test
Test your JavaScript skills at W3Schools!
content.html: Test your JavaScript skills at W3Schools!

content.text: Start JavaScript Quiz!
content.html: Start JavaScript Quiz!

content.text: Track Your Progress
Create a free W3Schools account and get access to more features and learning materials:

links.title: Sign up to try My Learning

content.text: Sign Up for Free
content.html: Sign Up for Free

content.text: Note: This is an optional feature. You can study at W3Schools without creating an account.
content.html: Note: This is an optional feature. You can study at W3Schools without creating an account.

content.text: JavaScript References
W3Schools maintains a complete JavaScript reference, including all HTML and browser objects.
content.html: W3Schools maintains a complete JavaScript reference, including all HTML and browser objects.

content.text: The reference contains examples for all properties, methods and events, and is continuously updated according to the latest web standards.
content.html: The reference contains examples for all properties, methods and events, and is continuously updated according to the latest web standards.

content.text: Kickstart your career
Get certified by completing the JavaScript course
content.html: Get certified by completing the JavaScript course
